definition: to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: Watching the distant views from this high point makes me completely relaxed and joyful.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得到這裏登高望遠真是心曠神怡。

sentences.english: People can still climb up the pagoda for a panoramic view.
sentences.chinese: 我們還可以爬上塔去登高望遠呢。

sentences.english: Oh, you mean we should climb atop them to have a panoramic view?
sentences.chinese: 噢，你的意思是想讓我們爬上去登高望遠啊？

sentences.english: Ascending a height can cultivate your sentiment.

definition: surging forward with great momentum/unfolding on a magnificent scale

(last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1])/(fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place
nuée ardente/hot cloud of volcanic ash
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)

pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4
